DOC.brief_summary: This pragmatic trial examines uptake effect primary care clinician commitment follow 3 Choosing Wisely® recommendation . The investigator hypothesize pre-encounter invitation clinician commit recommendation decrease order : ( 1 ) image test low back pain , ( 2 ) antibiotic acute sinusitis , ( 3 ) imaging test headache . The study mixed-methods , step wedge cluster randomize trial intervention sequentially introduce 6 clinic southeastern Michigan randomly assign order .
DOC.brief_title: Primary Care Clinician Commitments Choosing Wisely®
DOC.detailed_description: Clinicians often make decision order low-value service midst clinical encounter think rush susceptible patient demand . This pragmatic trial examines uptake effect shift clinician ' decision order low-value service pre-encounter period think slow deliberative ; invite clinician commit avoid order service patient encounter ; provide clinician commit decision support resource point-of-care reminder , patient education handout , access brief communication training . The investigator conduct mixed-methods , step wedge cluster randomize trial 6 IHA primary care clinic southeastern Michigan . The intervention introduce clinic sequence approximately one month apart randomly assign order ( i.e. , temporal randomization ) . In clinic intervention continue 1 6 month intervention end clinic time . For example , first clinic intervention run 6 month ; sixth clinic intervention run 1 month . The total length control period plus intervention period 8 month clinic . Prior start study , IHA make primary care clinician aware publicly available recommendation ABIM Foundation 's Choosing Wisely® campaign applicable avoid overuse low-value service 3 common condition : ( 1 ) low back pain , ( 2 ) acute sinusitis , ( 3 ) headache . However , research show clinician behavior seldom change result information alone . Therefore , start intervention period clinician invited make pre-encounter commitment follow 3 Choosing Wisely recommendation . Clinicians choose commit throughout intervention period receive point-of-care commitment reminder , Choosing Wisely patient education handout , weekly email decision support resource . Clinicians remain free order service time without penalty . The investigator measure whether clinician-focused intervention lead decline rate order image test low back pain , antibiotic acute sinusitis , image test headache . The study team analyze order pattern cost use clinical operation datasets ( draw electronic health record bill practice management system ) . The following hypothesis test : Hypothesis 1 : Inviting primary care clinician commit avoid order image low back pain , antibiotic acute sinusitis , image headache decrease order service . Hypothesis 2 : Inviting primary care clinician commit avoid order image low back pain , antibiotic acute sinusitis , image headache reduce health care cost patient visit low back pain , acute sinusitis , headache . Hypothesis 3 : Inviting primary care clinician commit avoid order low-value service reduce per-clinician per-visit health care cost across clinical condition . For outcome investigator also compare difference clinician commit follow 3 Choosing Wisely recommendation . Additionally , investigator compare difference outcomes 3-month follow-up period ( immediately intervention end ) control intervention period . After intervention period , study team conduct survey semi-structured interview study clinician . The survey result use identify correlate primary care clinician uptake invitation commit avoid order low-value service . The semi-structured interview elicit qualitative data clinician attitude towards overuse low-value service , clinician ' response intervention , facilitator barrier avoidance deliver low-value care .
DOC.criteria: Primary care clinicians 6 primary care ( family medicine internal medicine ) clinic within IHA organization Ann Arbor , Michigan
